text: I've been using Microsoft Paint as an IDE for years now, glad it's finally getting the recognition it deserves!
I can't even imagine coding in Paint. How do you even manage your project files?
It's all about organizing your layers properly. Each layer is a separate file, and you just need to manage the Z-order to control dependencies.
Not to mention the beauty of writing code in different colors and shapes. It's like creating art while coding!
This is just another example of how versatile and powerful MS Paint really is. From meme creation to full-stack development, it has everything you need.
I completely agree. It's always been an underrated gem. I've even built a neural network using MS Paint, and the performance was surprisingly good!
HOW DO YOU DEBUG CODE IN MS PAINT? DO YOU JUST DRAW LINES AROUND YOUR ERRORS?
Actually, I've developed a plugin that allows you to add breakpoints by drawing a red circle around the line of code you want to debug. Works like a charm!
I've found that using Paint as an IDE has actually made me a more efficient coder. The lack of autocompletion and syntax highlighting forces me to think more critically about my code.
Agreed! It's a great way to practice touch typing and memorization of syntax. Plus, I've started to really appreciate ASCII art in my comments.
Microsoft should really consider releasing a professional version of MS Paint tailored for developers. I'd definitely pay for that.
They could call it "Visual Studio Paint" or "MS Paint Pro". I can already picture the beautiful UI and powerful features!
